perturbation.original_text: Section 4.1. Term. The term of this Agreement commences on the Effective Date and continues in perpetuity, unless termination occurs pursuant to Sections 4.2 through 4.4.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.1. Term. The term of this Agreement commences on the Effective Date and continues for a period of five (5) years, unless terminated earlier pursuant to Sections 4.2 through 4.4.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement continues 'in perpetuity,' but the modified version limits the term to five years. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the agreement's duration.

perturbation.original_text: Section 4.2. Termination for Convenience. Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice for any reason, including if the usage of the Brand is not in compliance with the standards and policies.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.2. Termination for Convenience. Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement upon sixty (60) days written notice for any reason, including if the usage of the Brand is not in compliance with the standards and policies.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows for immediate termination upon written notice, while the modified version requires a 60-day notice period. This creates conflicting terms regarding the termination process.

perturbation.original_text: Section 9.1. Notice. Any notices herein shall be deemed to have been duly given if (i) delivered or delivered by facsimile, when received, (ii) sent by U.S. Express Mail or recognized overnight courier, on the following business day or (iii) delivered by electronic mail, when received:
perturbation.changed_text: Section 9.1. Notice. Any notices herein shall be deemed to have been duly given if (i) delivered or delivered by facsimile, when acknowledged by recipient, (ii) sent by U.S. Express Mail or recognized overnight courier, on the following business day or (iii) delivered by electronic mail, only after confirmation of receipt is automatically sent by the receiving server:
perturbation.explanation: The original text considers notices duly given 'when received', but the modified version requires acknowledgment for facsimile and receipt confirmation for emails. This creates conflicting requirements for valid notice, potentially leading to disputes over whether a notice was properly delivered.
